FuncDef: The display radius offline-sub-reason command displays offline sub-causes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the number of an offline sub-cause.
The value is an integer. The minimum value is 1. The maximum value increases with the number of offline sub-causes. For details about the parameter value range, see the command help information.

Examples: Subcode     description of offline sub reason
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To query an offline sub-cause with a specified number, run the display radius offline-sub-reason command.
The device sends Accounting Stop packets carrying RADIUS attribute 49 to the RADIUS server. The RADIUS attribute 49 (Acct-Terminate-Cause) identifies offline cause. To help the device support offline sub-causes, a Huawei proprietary attribute named huawei-181 (HW-Acct-terminate-subcause) is used to identify the offline sub-cause numbers. The offline sub-causes include all user logout causes displayed in the display aaa offline-record and display aaa online-fail-record commands
Sub-causes are not reported by default. You can run the radius-attribute include HW-Acct-terminate-subcause command in the RADIUS server group view for sub-causes to be reported.
For the relationships between standard reasons and sub-reasons, see Description > Feature Description > User Access > Appendix: RADIUS Attributes > Reasons for User Offline.
Precautions
Specifying an offline sub-cause number is recommended. If no offline sub-cause number is specified, all offline sub-causes will be displayed, difficult for you to locate required information.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
